text: I have found the if statements to sometimes be inconsistent when it comes to programmable email. Usually it works when storing the property value into a variable first, but you’re doing that. I haven’t tried crm_object so not sure on that one.

<@U2H3TT8F2> <@U7SL518D6> Is there anyone at HubSpot working on programmable email that’s in this Slack group? There’s the private channel but it’s pretty dead and I’m not sure <@U9KA594Q3> is around anymore?

Hey folks, interested in being able to include `dnd_area` in your custom email templates?
<https://community.HubSpot.com/t5/HubSpot-Ideas/dnd-area-in-custom-emailtemplate/idc-p/797669/highlight/true#M144308>

:wave: Hi, <@U024B4BNTQC> can you confirm that if you are using this in a module that the module you have `Enable module for programmable email beta` toggled on?

Also, if you are using a coded email template, can you confirm that your template annotation contains `isEnabledForEmailV3Rendering: true` added to it.

You can also send me a link to your email template in the design manager via a DM and I can see what I can find out for you.

Hi <@U2H3TT8F2> thanks for the response. I can confirm that the module has programmable email beta toggled on. However the coded template annotation does not contain
```isEnabledForEmailV3Rendering: true```
I will add that to the template annotation and test.
Sounds good, keep me updated Josh :slightly_smiling_face:. Also, thank you for the tag <@UKGV272KS>!

<@U2H3TT8F2> so it looks like it worked based on some test emails I just sent, however, in the email editor it's printing out some hubl and shows an error in the module about loading CRM object field. It doesn't show this in the sent email but wondering why it's showing this in the email editor.
hrmmm, I am not sure off hand. Let me see what I can find out.

This sounds cool. Unless this is directly related to email development though, you might have better luck in a different channel - maybe API or serverless-functions. Not sure the best channel but those might be better than this email dev channel. Just a thought, good luck, sounds like a cool app!

I think it has to do with how the emails are rendered in Marketing Hub? It was two stages if I recall correctly. I think there was a document ages ago that had info on the technical considerations for HubL in emails and known issues/bugs.
Interesting. And it wasn't outputting like that in the email editor until I put the in the template annotation "isEnabledForEmailV3Rendering: true". Not sure if it's related but something I noticed.
It is something specific for programmable emails, for sure. I’ve only seen it happen before with that.
I’ve passed this on along internally, will let you all know what i find out :slightly_smiling_face:
